page.title: 10 An Estate Village
page.content: Yardley Hastings was an estate village,and provided farm-workers for the "Compton Estate",belonging to the Marquis of Northampton.Now that farming is highly mechanised,it no longer requires the same level of manpower. As a consequence of this the character of the village has changed with many of the houses being sold off to people who commute to work outside the village. The old names of the village such as the Whitleys,Robinsons and Underwoods are disappearing,names which have provided a sense of continuity with he past .Yardley Hastings used to contain almost all the different trades to make it self sufficient. Today it can still boast to having its own builders,carpeners, decorators, plumbers, and a thriving Thatching business
